title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.7.7 | 10-12-2021
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyana Timiran Dhasya Gyanan Janishalakaya
Chakshurun Militam Yena Tasvai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnupadaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale
Shri Mate Bhakti Vedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine
Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pashchatya Deshatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda
Shri Advaita Gadadhara Shiva Sadhi Gauravatta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya
Narayanam Namaskritya Naramchaiva Narottamam
Deveem Saraswateem Vyasam Tato Jayam Udhirayet
In this session we will be discussing from the 7th verse of the 7th chapter
of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam
Asyamvai Shruyamanayam
Krishnay Parama Purushe
Bhaktir Utpadyate Pumsaha
Shokamoha Bhayapaha
The meaning of this verse is
Simply by giving oral reception to this Vedic literature
referring to the Srimad Bhagavatam
The feeling for loving devotional service to Lord Krishna
the Supreme Personality of Godhead
sprouts up at once to extinguish the fire of lamentation, illusion and fearfulness
See how effective Srimad Bhagavatam is
Simply you have to hear this called giving oral reception
You have to give oral reception means you have to hear attentively
And simply you have to do that
What did Pariksit Maharaj do?
He simply sat and heard Shukadev Goswami speak
for 7 days and nights continuously
That's all he did
He didn't do any gymnastics
But he was hearing with complete attention
He was fully absorbed in the subject matter
So much so that Shukadev Goswami said that
Do you want to take a break?
He said no
There is no need for any break because
through my ears I'm drinking the nectar
of the words of the Srimad Bhagavatam spoken by Shukadev Goswami
So that nectar makes one
indifferent to thirst
thirst, hunger, sleep, all these things cannot disturb a person who's completely immersed
in hearing the Srimad Bhagavatam.
So how does it work?
That's what he said here, simply by giving oral reception to this Vedic literature, simply
by hearing Srimad Bhagavatam attentively, the feeling for loving devotional service
to Lord Krishna, the Supreme Personality of God, it sprouts up at once.
It is awakened, it's there in the heart.
This you have heard earlier, Nitya Siddha Krishna Prema Sadhya Kabuna.
It is already there in the heart, this love for Krishna, but it is awakened by this process
of attentive hearing of the Srimad Bhagavatam.
And what does it do?
It extinguishes the fire of lamentation, illusion and fearfulness.
This is explained by Srila Prabhupada in the purport, Prabhupada says, there are various
senses of which the ear is the most effective ear.
This sense works even when a man is deep asleep.
One can protect himself from the hands of an enemy while awake.
But while asleep, one is protected by the ear only.
The importance of hearing is mentioned here in connection with attaining the highest perfection
of life, namely getting free from three material pangs.
Everyone is full of lamentation at every moment.
Everyone is full of lamentation at every moment.
Everyone is full of lamentation at every moment.
Material life means constant lamentation and everyone is after the mirage of illusory
things.
The whole material creation is a creation of the illusory energy.
And so many objects are there which bewilder the mind and people are simply running after
this mirage.
Mirage means something, a phenomenon or a death.
Mirage means something, a phenomenon or a death.
In a desert, there is no water, but it appears like there is a body of water at a distance
and one chases that body of water and never gets any water because there is no real water
there in that mirage.
Similarly in this material world, so many objects seem to be promising so much of happiness,
but actually none of those objects can give us any real pleasure.
And thirdly, he is always afraid of his supposed enemy, Shoka, Moha, Bhaya, these are three
material pangs, which everyone in this material world who is born under the force of karma
has to face.
These are the primary symptoms of material disease, Bhavaroga, it is called Bhavaroga,
the disease of repeated birth and death.
Everyone is affected by this disease in this material world and the primary symptoms just
like if somebody has got a viral infection, then they have a symptom called fever or some
body pain.
Vomiting, loose motion, whatever, like that, what is the symptom of this material disease
that is described as these three symptoms Shoka, Moha, Bhaya.
Shoka is lamentation, Moha is illusion and Bhaya is fear.
And it is definitely suggested here in that simply by hearing the message of Srimad Bhagavatam,
one gets attachment for the supreme personality.
Krishna is very, very attractive, but you have to hear about Krishna from the pure devotee.
Because the pure devotee presents factually the actual personality of Godhead, not some
speculated theory or some, some mental concoction, no, real Supreme Lord is presented by the
pure devotee.
And as soon as this is affected, the symptoms of the material diseases disappear.
As soon as you hear from a pure devotee, the actual message of the Bhagavatam, immediately
it relieves you from these three material pangs, immediately, you feel relief.
And that is the most encouraging part of the Bhagavad Gita.
The process of Bhakti, Srila Vyasadeva saw the all perfect personality of Godhead and
in this statement, the all perfect personality of Godhead Shri Krishna is clearly confirmed.
The ultimate result of devotional service is to develop genuine love for the first Supreme
personality.
We have love for Krishna, but this is awakened only by this process of Bhakti.
It cannot be awakened by the process of Jnana, Karma or Yoga.
No material methods are possible to be practiced in order to awaken our genuine devotion or
genuine love for Krishna.
Love is a word which is often used in relation with man and woman.
And love is the only word that can be properly used to indicate the relation between Lord
Krishna and the living entities.
Why is that?
Because the living entities are described as Prakriti in the Bhagavad Gita.
Apareyam itasthu anyam prakritim viddhime paraam.
Material energy is described as Apara Prakriti, living entities are described as Para Prakriti.
So, we are Prakriti.
Prakriti is feminine.
Prakriti is female.
Prakriti is feminine.
Prakriti is feminine.
Prakriti is feminine.
The Lord is always described as the Parama Purusha, the supreme male personality.
Thus, the affection between the Lord and the living entities is something like the affection
between the male and the female in this material world.
See why this is being said is because we have experienced what is the kind of affection
that exists between a male and a female.
So the term love of God.
Love of God is quite appropriate.
If you understand from this perspective, we are feminine in terms of being Prakriti and
the Lord is the supreme male.
So the relationship is one of love.
That is how Prabhupada explains in this purport.
Loving devotional service to the Lord begins with hearing about the Lord.
Shravanam.
Shravanam.
Shravanam.
Shravanam.
This process for executing devotional service is hearing.
There is no difference between the Lord and the subject matter heard about him.
This is the absolute nature of Krishna.
His descriptions are identical with his personality.
The Lord is absolute in all respects and thus there is no difference between him and the
subject matter heard about him.
Therefore, hearing about him means immediate contact with him.
The Lord is an absolute in all respects and thus there is no difference between him and
the subject matter heard about him.
him by the process of vibration of the transcendental sound the sound which is emanating from the
lips of the pure devotee when the devotee pure devotee describes the Supreme Lord Krishna
that sound is a transcendental vibration and the transcendental sound is so effective that
it acts at once by removing all material affections mentioned above everything is completely cleansed
away by the powerful sound of the description of the Supreme Lord as mentioned before a
living entity develops a sort of complexity by material association and the illusory engagement
of the material body is accepted as an actual fact we are entangled in this world and we
accept this
illusion as something which is real why is it called illusion illusion means something
which is not real you accept as real something which is not fact you accept as fact and the
actual fact is rejected as something which is not real this is the whole basis of illusion
under such false complexity the living beings under different categories of life
and
become illusion in different ways the way the illusory energy works is different for different
living entities just like a dog male dog is attracted to a female dog a male pig is
attracted to a female pig now from our perspective the pig may be a very ugly creature or a
filthy living in a filthy place in a gutter eating stool abominable existence but the evil energy
of illusion is such that the soul in a male pig's body is attracted to the female pigs body simply
to enjoy sex life you see same thing happens even in bird society animal society even in human
society also the same thing happens in the whole nature of the Universe by treating what is called
happens so she la prabhupada says even in the most developed stage of human life the same illusion
prevails in the form many isms and divides the loving relation between the lord and the living
entities thereby it divides the loving relation between man and man between one living one human
being another human being but by hearing the subject matter of srimad bhagavatam this false
complexity of materialism is removed and real peace in society begins which politicians aspire
for so eagerly in many political situations so peace is the the prerequisite for love
there is no possibility of love without peace
as long as our mind is agitated disturbed there is no possibility of love experiencing love
so the srimad bhagavatam
is the only literature which gives us perfect description of the supreme lord which is
identical with the lord and such contact with the lord through simply hearing attentively
will ensure that
our heart becomes cleansed of all these misconceptions all the all the wrong
understanding all the material complexities are removed and love is at once awakened
so that is the that is the process that's how it works i'll stop here thank you very much
harikusha
